TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: Go Play Economic Boom!

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_nd3p2pD45z1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/3062558db4580aeed1170feef20a6c2f/tumblr_inline_nd3p3nzlml1rr2wit.png"/></p>

<p>Play KSP: Economic Boom and enjoy yourselves. As for us, it’s back to the grind tomorrow. Onward and upward to the next one!</p>
I would, but I'm at work

#SecondPoster

I hope I can get this tomorrow.
I'm waiting for my mods to be updated, but I'll check it out the instant they're ready to go!
I would if your download wasn't 12kb/s. I hope you get that fixed.

I would if your download wasn't 12kb/s. I hope you get that fixed.

you beat me.

I was at 13Ko/s minimum(sometime it went up).

After a while(a long time), I went to diner. When I came back, I tried another time the download and it went faster(1.2Mb/s)
Dear god, 50kb/s for me. All speed tests show my downstream speed as 15+mb/s... SQUAD pls :'(
Wait its out!!! I was counting on halloween as a release. I will play it as soon as i get home.
On steam, it downloaded within a few seconds. [/evilgrin]
I might have to buy this game on steam just to DL the update! Cheers on a job well done, cya in 2.5 months!

Dear god, 50kb/s for me. All speed tests show my downstream speed as 15+mb/s... SQUAD pls :'(

High load, presumably. Also, I believe most ISPs keep special channels open for speed test sites to make themselves look better.

On steam, it downloaded within a few seconds. [/evilgrin]

Yeah, the download was just a few seconds, but it was 'in queue,' for about 15 minutes before it downloaded. Just enough time for the first pot of coffee to explode....er.....brew...!

Yeah, I DL'd it, updated the few mods that were already updated for 0.25, and tried to start the game. Tried. It crashed on loading, and the output log said it was an 'out of memory' crash. And that's WITH 'Active Texture Management', btw.

Based on past experience with new versions horribly breaking most mods, I'll be lucky if I can even get the game to run by Halloween.

Warning: session_start(): The session id is too long or contains illegal characters, valid characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9 and '-,' in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php on line 9

Warning: session_start(): Cannot send session cookie - headers already sent by (output started at /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php:9) in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php on line 9

Warning: session_start(): Cannot send session cache limiter - headers already sent (output started at /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php:9) in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php on line 9

Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php:9) in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/multiplayDwn.php on line 11

Invalid Token

Session Overload! Be thankful if you still able to get something going on.
Heh, predicted it would be today. I'm getting unnervingly good at this.

And that's WITH 'Active Texture Management', btw.

Yeah, that's your problem. ATM doesn't seem to be working in 0.25 currently, so the game acts like it's not installed at all, hence the OOM crashes.
*smile slowly spreads across face*

On the speeds in the KSP store, it's confirmed to be caused by the server load. There's unfortunately nothing we can do about it from our end, but our host has been notified and we hope that things can lighten up a bit by the morning. Thanks.

Looks like I won't be playing with destructible buildings just yet...

The launchpad is a bit too fragile. I suggest the game ignoring any impacts less than 30m/s so we can launch our oversized rockets without launch clamps.

Edited October 8, 2014 by Giggleplex777
just an fyi the patcher isn't deleting files in the squad folder so we have a lot of duplicate/depreciated parts messing stuff up if we use the updater.

just an fyi the patcher isn't deleting files in the squad folder so we have a lot of duplicate/depreciated parts messing stuff up if we use the updater.

As a rule of thumb, I like to freshen installs thoroughly for games like KSP were assets are not merged into a single file.

Saves up a whole lot of trouble usually. Makes troubleshooting easier too as I can be sure not leftover files are conflicting.
